benchmark_details.name: Beyond Final Answers: Evaluating Large Language Models for Math Tutoring
benchmark_details.overview: This study presents two novel approaches to evaluate the correctness and quality of Large Language Models (LLMs) in math tutoring contexts, using automated problem generation and human evaluators.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the potential of LLMs in education by assessing their performance on structured algebra tasks.

data.source: Generated problems and solutions via the Apprentice Tutors platform.
data.annotation: Human verification and qualitative coding process.

methodology.calculation: Calculations made based on correctness of LLM responses compared to established solutions.
methodology.interpretation: High-quality instructional support is determined based on rubric scoring.
methodology.validation: Manual human verification of LLM responses.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for generating incorrect solutions leading to misconceptions.
